snippet: Sitting improperly on a subway seat is perhaps the most minor crime for which New Yorkers are routinely arrested.
abstract: New York subway riders are suddenly facing enforcement of laws against minor offenses like putting their feet on subway car seats; New York CIty Police Department points to lowered crime statistics as justification of enforcement but critics suspect that police officers are driven by the prospect of overtime pay and the pressure to meet quotas.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY

lead_paragraph: Sitting improperly on a subway seat is perhaps the most minor crime for which New Yorkers are routinely arrested.

headline.seo: Minor Offenses on N.Y. Subway Can Bring a Ticket, or Handcuffs
headline.main: Relax, if You Want, but Don’t Put Your Feet Up
headline.print_headline: Bad Manners Then, Cause for Arrest Today
